content: please change your validators since its really easy to hardcode it and use only numbers 0-5 in the code and leave all the other numbers out. this can be unfair in shortest mode
i just corrected the spelling in the title since no such word like 'speach' exists and it is usually confused with the correct spelling which is 'speech'. im surprised no one spotted this out lol.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun exercise ! The description of the subject is clear and the test cases are good.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approve of this challenge because it is very well explained and above all very satisfying when you solve it especially in reverse mode.

I like the idea - but when solving it I realized that it came down to copying the spelled numbers, putting square brackets around it, using the digit as list-index, and then replace old for new (Python). Felt like a shame to only spend 20 seconds on such a nice clash idea.

I do agree that you put the spelled-out numbers in the statement (no need to turn this clash into a typing match). However, I expected to encounter multiple old/new in the later cases, which would have forced me to at least loop over the old and new. Possibly even a new one reused as old (for example v f but also f v), so that you have to be careful with replacing (i.e. five should become vife but if you are not careful you turn it into fife and then vive).
But hey, that's just my opinion :man_shrugging:.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Funny even if it benefits fast writters

Goal
* Although I assume most people know how to spell "zero" to "nine" in English, I would still suggest you to list them all out for the benefit of players whose first language isn't English.

Also, this is a programming challenge, not an English spelling test.

* Please change "[[i]]" to "[[digit]] in English" because i is undefined and the language should be mentioned.

* Last line: please format "digit" as a [[variable]] instead of a {{constant}}, and remove the quotation marks.

Input
* Line 2: Please add "separated by a space".

Constraints
* Please remove the second constraint.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar. Please revise the "But here we did" validator to be similar to "No mistake" test (i.e. old letter not in the correct spelling).

Stub generator
* Please use the same variable name as in other sections (D => digit).

Thanks.
Please always write a reason when you approve or reject a contribution. Thanks.
